definition: Beijing Airport (PEK)/also translated as Capital Airport
head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
all/both/entirely/(used for emphasis) even/already/(not) at all
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: Located along Jiangtai Road, south of Holiday Inn Lido Beijing. Short drive to the airport.
sentences.chinese: 位于京顺路，丽都酒店的南面，去首都机场很方便。

sentences.english: Reporters also learned that the second half of this year the airport will be a large-scale capital investment.
sentences.chinese: 记者还了解到，今年下半年首都机场将大规模招商。

sentences.english: Chen Zuo’er and division chief Zhang hurried to Beijing Capital Airport in the same day afternoon to meet Li and Xu.
sentences.chinese: 陈佐洱和张处长于当日下午赶往首都机场迎接。

sentences.english: It is located in the southwest side of the terminal of Beijing Capital Airport, in the northern part of the Airport's living area.
sentences.chinese: 坐落于首都机场航站楼西南侧，位于机场生活区北端。

sentences.english: The as-cast-finish concrete technology of The Capital Airport control tower.
sentences.chinese: 首都机场塔台清水混凝土施工技术。

sentences.english: They both cried on each other's shoulder at capital airport.
sentences.chinese: 在首都机场，两个人抱头痛哭。

sentences.english: Finally, I thought whether there would be a Tea Bar called Cao Xueqin in the capital airport.
sentences.chinese: 也想到首都机场是否也可以有一个叫曹雪芹的茶社。

sentences.english: Mr. Ma on the site of Terminal 2 of Beijing Capital International Airport.
sentences.chinese: 在首都机场2号航站楼施工现场。

pinyin: Shou3 du1 Guo2 ji4 Ji1 chang3

definition: Beijing Nanyuan Airport, military air base and secondary civil airport of Beijing
pinyin: Bei3 jing1 Nan2 yuan4 Ji1 chang3

definition: Air China (abbr. for 中國國際航空公司|中国国际航空公司[Zhong1 guo2 Guo2 ji4 Hang2 kong1 Gong1 si1])
